title: 2 Simple Ways to Forget a Network on a MacBook or Mac

steps.title: Click the Apple menu.
steps.content: Click the Apple menu. This is in the top-left corner. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click System Settings.
steps.content: Click System Settings . This is in the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Wi-Fi.
steps.content: Click Wi-Fi . You can find this in the sidebar.

steps.title: Click Details.
steps.content: Click Details . This is next to the Wi-Fi network you're currently connected to . To forget a network you connected to in the past, scroll down and click Advanced . Click ••• next to the network, select Remove From List , and then click Remove .

steps.title: Click Forget This Network.
steps.content: Click Forget This Network . This is in the pop-up menu.

steps.title: Click Remove.
steps.content: Click Remove . This will confirm the action, and the network will be forgotten. If you have more networks you want to forget, repeat these steps. You can also change the default network .

steps.title: Click the Apple menu.
steps.content: Click the Apple menu. This is in the top-left corner.

steps.title: Click System Preferences.
steps.content: Click System Preferences . This is in the drop-down menu.

steps.title: Click Network.
steps.content: Click Network . You'll see this in the list of apps.

steps.title: Click Wi-Fi.
steps.content: Click Wi-Fi . You can find this in the sidebar.

steps.title: Click Advanced.
steps.content: Click Advanced . This will load all networks you've connected to on your Mac.

steps.title: Select the network you want to forget.
steps.content: Select the network you want to forget. It will be highlighted.

steps.title: Click (-) Remove.
steps.content: Click (-) Remove. You can find this underneath the list of networks.

steps.title: Click Remove.
steps.content: Click Remove . The network will be removed.

steps.title: Click OK, and then Apply.
steps.content: Click OK , and then Apply . Your changes will be saved. If you have more networks you want to forget, repeat these steps.
